post_meta.add_description: Die missie van Amikumu is om 'n sosiale netwerk te skep en te handhaaf wat sprekers, signers en gebruikers van die hele wêreld se tale 'n platform aan te bied om te kommunikeer en relevante inligting plaaslik, ongeag van die sosiale, politieke of ekonomiese status van elke taal, te deel.
post_meta.metadata_desc: Die span van Amikumu bestaan uit veeltaliges van regoor die wêreld wat ontelbare ure daaraan gewy het om tale te bemeester.
post_meta.team_members_0_description: Richard Delamore, bekend deur sy aanlyn skuilnaam Evildea, is 'n Australiese Esperanto YouTube-persoonlikheid en leidende figuur in die Esperanto rolprentbedryf. Voor die mede-stigting Amikumu, het Richard Esperanto-TV gestig en op die Raad van Direkteure gedien vir die Australian Esperanto Association (AEA), die Language Festival Association (LFA) en die Esperanto Federation of New South Wales (EFNSW). Daarbenewens, het hy ses jaar in die Australiese weermag as 'n seinoperateur gedien en gewerk vir talle internasionale besighede as 'n stelseladministrateur.
post_meta.team_members_0_quote: Amikumu is an essential part of every language learner’s toolkit.
post_meta.team_members_1_description: Chuck Smith is die mede-organiseerder van die Polyglot Gathering, bydraer tot Duolingo se Esperanto-kursus en stigter van die Esperanto Wikipedia, asook ander Esperanto- en veeltalige-projekte. Hy ontwikkel iOS-programme al sedert Apple se App Store in 2008 bekendgestel is. Hy het die idee gehad om 'n GPS-toestel te kry om mede-Esperanto-sprekers te vind terwyl hy in 2002 deur Brasilië gereis het, maar moes 15 jaar wag vir tegnologie om in te haal, sodat hy hierdie droom kon voortduur. Nou sien hy uit na die uitdagings wat voorlê om mense te help om die wêreld 'n beter plek te maak.
post_meta.team_members_1_quote: I love seeing all the great ways people are meeting up to speak different languages with Amikumu all over the world!
post_meta.team_members_1_job_title: Chief Technical Officer and Mobile Developer
post_meta.team_members_1_languages: Engels, Esperanto, Duits, Spaans, Frans, Nederlands, Pools, Amerikaanse Gebaretaal

team_members_2_description.#text:
Tanja is a stay at home geek who has extensive experience in customer support (both front and back office) for several ISPs. In her free time she codes, creates various items with yarn and plays videogames (or does the New York Times crossword puzzle).

After re-entering the world of Esperanto, she voluntarily helped rewrite the code for the current version of Amikumu, as well as being responsible for the layout.

post_meta.team_members_2_quote: Amikumu makes it so easy to meet new people who share my interests, no matter where I am. I love working on an app that I use myself and help users get the best experience out of it!
post_meta.team_members_3_description: Judith Meyer is 'n rekenaarmatige taalkundige wat meeste van haar tyd deurbring webtoepassings te ontwikkel wat tale hanteer, soos haar projek LearnYu. Sy is ook 'n veeltalige, mede-organiseerder van die Polyglot Gathering en skrywer van talle taalboeke en taalkursusse. She learned Esperanto when she was 14 years old so as to use it as a springboard to learning many other languages.
post_meta.team_members_3_quote: Amikumu is a boon for polyglots like me – I'm always surprised by who speaks Greek, Hebrew or Indonesian around me.”
post_meta.team_members_3_languages: Duits, Engels, Esperanto, Latyns, Frans, Italiaans, Moderne Grieks, Mandaryns, Nederlands, Spaans, Indonesies, Hebreeus, Swahili
post_meta.team_members_4_description: Jesse Alter is 'n Linux-stelseladministrateur met grade in Rekenaarwetenskap en Maatskaplike Werk. Oor die jare het Jesse bedieners vir verskeie webwerwe en -dienste onderhou terwyl hy as pediatriese maatskaplike werker gewerk het. Hy het later sy loopbaan verander om sy lewenslange belangstelling in die ontwikkeling en instandhouding van rekenaarstelsels na te volg. Benewens Amikumu, sluit Jesse se belangstellings retrocomputing, inligtingsprivaatheid en data-ontleding in.
post_meta.team_members_4_quote: Amikumu gives me the ability to instantly find language partners for any language I know or am interested in, wherever I am. Vir my, is dit 'n "superkrag."
post_meta.team_members_5_description: Elena Khusanova is 'n bekwame grafiese ontwerper met 'n diploma in argitektuurteorie. Nadat sy gradueer het, het sy Esperanto aangeleer en het sy sedertdien vir verskeie organisasies en geleenthedede gewerk. Hoogtepunte sluit haar vrywillige diens vir E@I in Slowakye en die 101ste Wêreld Esperanto-kongres in onder ander projekte. Onlangs het sy haar 'n eie projek voltooi: kaarte vir die speletjie "Weerwolwe".
post_meta.team_members_5_quote: The beauty of Amikumu is that it doesn’t only help me find new language partners, but also make new friends offline.
post_meta.team_members_5_languages: Engels, Russies, Esperanto, Slowaaks, Sweeds, Toki Pona

section.title: What is an ambassador?
section.#text: Essentially, an ambassador is someone who helps promote Amikumu within their local community. They're our representatives on the ground! Our biggest fans and greatest supporters.

section.title: What does an Ambassador do?
section.ul:
#. They're publishing blog posts and YouTube videos! For example, check out `Amikumu: The App Yiddish Speakers have been Waiting for! [https://youtu.be/6g3QtBtBB_U]`_ (Moshe Sherizen) and `Auslan: What is Amikumu? [https://youtu.be/57W73If51NE]`_ (Kiah Morante) among others. We have an entire page dedicated to `press releases [http://amikumu.com/press/]`_.
 	#. They're posting links in Facebook groups and on their profiles. Even a simple show of public support can go a long way!
 	#. They're handing out flyers and talking about Amikumu in local language meetups. This is also a great way to establish and grow a local community.
 	#. They're `translating the app [https://crowdin.com/project/amikumu/invite?d=a5j626v495h50743f3o4r4c3h4]`_ and website to their local languages. Our goal is to become the most translated app in the world and we need all the help to achieve this.
 	#. They're providing vitally important guidance. We understand that every language and culture is different. We want and need your advise on how to best act in your community.
section.#text: It depends on what they can commit. We've listed some of the ways our ambassadors are working with us to promote Amikumu around the world.

section.title: What do Ambassadors get?
section.#text: There's little we can provide for your invaluable help. However, there are a few perks to being an ambassador. We provide ambassadors with unique in-app collectible badges among other things. Feel free to reach out to us for more info at `info@amikumu.com [mailto:info@amikumu.com]`_.

post_content.#text: Firstly, a massive thanks for your interest in the Ambassador program.

post_meta.metadata_desc: An Amikumu ambassador is someone who helps promote Amikumu within their local community. They're our representatives on the ground! Our biggest fans and greatest supporters.

subsection.title: What is Amikumu?
subsection.#text: Amikumu is an app that helps you find people nearby to speak any language with. For example, while on holiday, use Amikumu to meet up with Spanish, French or any other language speakers in town.

subsection.title: How does it work?
subsection.ol: #. Create an account manually or with Facebook. #. Kies die tale wat jy praat en op watter vlak. Daar meer as 7000 (insluitend 100+ gebaretale) op ons databasis. #. Write a custom name and description for each language you speak. #. Filter the Nearby list to find the 100 people closest nearby who speak your target language(s). #. Contact others and meetup!

subsection.title: Is dit gratis?
subsection.#text: Ja.

subsection.title: Which platforms does Amikumu support?
subsection.#text: Amikumu is beskikbaar vir Android (OS 4.0.3) en iOS 9.1 (iPhone 4S, iPad 2 +).

subsection.title: Can others always see exactly where I am?
subsection.#text: Jou privaatheid en veiligheid is baie belangrik vir ons. Amikumu stoor of wys nie presiese liggings nie.

subsection.title: Hoe kan ek verseker dat vreemde mense nie met my in verbinding tree nie?
subsection.#text: Jy kan nie, maar Amikumu beskik oor 'n funksie om gebruikers te blokkeer. Wanneer jy 'n gebruiker blokkeer, dan kan hulle jou nie meer sien of met jou in verbinding tree nie.

subsection.title: Is Amikumu oopbron?
subsection.#text: Ons by Amikumu is 'n goedgunstig teenoor oopbron. Ongelukkig, pas oopbron tans nie in by ons organisasie nie. Ons is, egter op soek na geleenthede om te oopbron wanneer ons voel dat dit reg vir ons is.

subsection.title: Can I translate Amikumu?
subsection.#text: Ja, jy kan help om Amikumu na`jou taal hier [https://crowdin.com/project/amikumu/invite?d=a5j626v495h50743f3o4r4c3h4]`_.

subsection.title: Wat beteken Amikumu?
subsection.#text: Amikumu beteken in Esperanto "om die vriend ding te doen".

subsection.title: Hoe kan ek betrokke raak?
subsection.#text: Ons verwelkom jou terugvoer so sluit aan by `ons poslys [http://eepurl.com/c4qiRD]`_, of volg ons op `Facebook (oba Bakkiesboek) [https://www.facebook.com/amikumuapp/]`_, `Twitter [https://twitter.com/Amikumu]`_ en`VK bladsy [https://vk.com/amikumu]`_om ingelig te bly. Vir verdere vrae, slaan ons by`info@amikumu.com [mailto:info@amikumu.com]`_>

post_meta.metadata_desc: Find and connect instantly with local language partners nearby. We are the only app that supports 7,000+ languages including Catalan, Chinese, Dutch, Esperanto, Irish, Japanese, Occitan, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Toki Pona and Welsh, all for FREE!

post_content.ol:
#. Name for the advertisement
 	#. High quality picture for the advertisement
 	#. Description for the advertisement (300 characters max)
 	#. Email address
 	#. Phone number
 	#. Website
 	#. Address (only relevant for advertisements that have a physical address)
 	#. Advertisement address (your advertisement can appear anywhere in the world). For example your event might be in New York but you want to attract people from London. Therefore, London is the advertisement address

post_meta.additional_month: for each additional month (must be paid in advance)
post_meta.advertise_teaser: A location based advertisement that only the 100 people closest nearby see.
post_meta.advertise_text: Amikumu is a social network that provides speakers, signers and users of all the world's languages with a platform to communicate and share relevant information locally. Our users are primarily polyglots and speakers of minority languages.
post_meta.complete_analysis_part1: For a complete analysis of our language stats please see our
post_meta.in_app_collectible_badges_text: An in-app collectible badge that appears on the user's profile page. Perfect for advertising large-scale meetups, language festivals or seminars and for providing an additional award for participation in events.
post_meta.metadata_desc: Find and connect instantly with local language partners nearby. We are the only app that supports 7,000+ languages including Catalan, Chinese, Dutch, Esperanto, Irish, Japanese, Occitan, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Toki Pona and Welsh, all for FREE!
post_meta.prices_assume: The above prices assume that your advertisement is targeting only one language. For each additional language, there is an extra 4€ a month fee. There are no additional setup fees.
post_meta.purchase_email_text_part2: with the above details for each language advertisement.
post_meta.purchase_info: All advertisement purchases must be conducted in English or Esperanto.

post_meta.claim: The mission of Amikumu is to create and maintain a social network that provides speakers, signers and users of all the world's languages with a platform to communicate and share relevant information locally, regardless of the social, political or economic status of each language.
post_meta.massive_thanks: A massive thanks to all our 429 backers on Kickstarter who smashed our funding goals and made Amikumu a reality
post_meta.metadata_desc: Find and connect instantly with local language partners nearby. We are the only app that supports 7,000+ languages including Catalan, Chinese, Dutch, Esperanto, Irish, Japanese, Occitan, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Toki Pona and Welsh, all for FREE!
post_meta.testimonials_block_0_add_sortcontent: I never know which city I’m going to wake up in next, and yet I want to practice all my languages. With this app, I can practice any language I want at the push of a button!
post_meta.testimonials_block_1_add_sortcontent: I believe that Amikumu is an incredibly useful app for the language learning community!
post_meta.testimonials_block_2_add_sortcontent: The app can enhance communication among speakers of endangered languages and revivalists of dreaming sleeping beauties such as Barngarla.
post_meta.testimonials_block_3_add_sortcontent: We are inspired by Amikumu and their ambition to unite us through the languages we speak – or aspire to speak!
post_meta.testimonials_block_4_add_name: Welsh Government App of the Week
post_meta.testimonials_block_4_add_sortcontent: Amikumu adds a whole new dimension to language learning and is changing the way people connect and practice languages.
post_meta.tutorial_blocks_0_text:
Add a bio and name for each language you speak!

Indicate which languages you know and how well you speak them.>
post_meta.tutorial_blocks_1_text:
Choose a language.

Find people nearby who also speak that language.>
post_meta.tutorial_blocks_1_title: Find language learning partners nearby anytime, anywhere
post_meta.tutorial_blocks_2_text:
Message others nearby who speak your language.

Send pictures, voice messages and map coordinates.

Quickly organize meetups and make friends for life.>

post_meta.metadata_desc: Welcome to the Amikumu press page. Here you can find countless links to articles about Amikumu in different languages.
Visit the online Amikumu shop and get one of our awesome t-shirts to help raise awareness of Amikumu in your local community.

Find and connect instantly with local language partners nearby. We are the only app that supports 7,000+ languages including Catalan, Chinese, Dutch, Esperanto, Irish, Japanese, Occitan, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Toki Pona and Welsh, all for FREE!

subsection.title: 1. Sign up to our newsletter
subsection.#text: Each month we publish a newsletter with behind-the-scenes insights about our plans and successes. We also accept contributions from our community members such as yourself. This is our way of talking directly with you. `Sign up here [http://eepurl.com/c4qiRD]`_.

subsection.title: 2. Follow us on social media
subsection.#text: We have a social media presence on the most popular websites.

subsection.title: 3. Share us with your friends
subsection.#text:
Share our app with your friends on social media or by email!

The more people hear about Amikumu, the more useful it becomes for us all. Share a link to our official website `www.amikumu.com [https://www.amikumu.com]`_ along with why you enjoy it so much.

subsection.title: 4. Help translate the app and website!
subsection.#text:
Our aim is to become the most translated app in the world! This is not easy, so we need your help!

To contribute to an existing translation or start a new one, please sign up to `CrowdIn [https://crowdin.com/project/amikumu/invite?d=a5j626v495h50743f3o4r4c3h4]`_ (our preferred translation service) and select the language you want to translate. There's no required minimum, you can translate the entire app or just a single word–you decide.

subsection.title: 5. Purchase a Gold Membership!
subsection.#text: Gold membership provides additional features such as virtual teleportation and additional privacy settings. However, it's also a great way to show your support and provide us with valuable funding! You can purchase Gold Membership from within the app (coming soon!).

subsection.title: 6. Purchase a T-shirt or mug!
subsection.#text: A t-shirt is a simple yet powerful means to raise awareness of Amikumu. Check out our `online shop [https://www.amikumu.com/shop/#!/]`_.

subsection.title: 7. Print and distribute our flyers
subsection.#text: `We've prepared flyers you can distribute [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1dDB0mvFuLXYycQtA1ZSxgOCJR-2gHAXv?usp=sharing]`_ in your school, university and local language club. They have also been translated into many languages for your use. If you need custom flyers made, please contact us at `info@amikumu.com [mailto:info@amikumu.com]`_

subsection.title: 8. Organize meetups!
subsection.#text:
Last but not least, meet people with Amikumu and share your stories! We love to share stories of successful meetups with our community. Email us your stories and pics to `info@amikumu.com. [mailto:info@amikumu.com]`_

Finally, massive thanks in advance for any way you can help.

If you have any ideas or suggestions, feel free to contact us at `info@amikumu.com [mailto:info@amikumu.com]`_.>

post_content.#text:
Thank you for your interest in supporting Amikumu.

Here are 8 easy ways to show your support and help grow our community.
